    "name": "a(n) is the smallest positive integer of length (distance from origin) n in the Cayley graph of the integers generated by all powers of 7.",

        "Conjectures from _Colin Barker_, Dec 28 2017: (Start)",
        "G.f.: x*(1 + x + x^2 - 6*x^3) / ((1 - x)*(1 - 7*x^3)).",
        "a(n) = a(n-1) + 7*a(n-3) - 7*a(n-4) for n>4.",
        "(End)",
        "The second conjecture by Colin Barker is true up to n=1000. - _Lars Blomberg_, Dec 29 2017"
